message.content: This question requires some basic knowledge about soil formation. Pebbles are not suitable for planting seeds because they lack the necessary nutrients and moisture retention capacity. However, over time, weathering processes like erosion, deposition, and biological activity break down the pebbles into smaller particles, creating soil. Option (B) is incorrect because light rain alone may not provide enough water to break down the pebbles. Option (C) is also incorrect because cloudy days do not directly contribute to the formation of soil. Option (D) is not related to soil formation, as singing does not have any effect on transforming pebbles into soil.

This question requires an understanding of the process of soil formation. Over time, pebbles and other geological materials undergo weathering and erosion, which breaks them down into smaller particles. Over an extended period, these particles mix with organic matter and water to form soil. Option (B) is incorrect because light rain alone is not sufficient to break down pebbles into soil. Option (C) is also incorrect because cloudy days do not have a direct impact on soil formation. Option (D) is unrelated to the process of soil formation and has no effect on pebbles becoming soil.
